resources.string: It may take a while for the GPS to locate the satellites. Make sure that you are outside and your phone has a clear view of the sky.
To improve GPS readings, move away from tall buildings, trees or overhead obstructions.
GPS signal is weak or not available.
Please move to an open area and place your device in a location that will have a full exposure to the sky. Try to stay motionless until getting the GPS fix.
GPS accuracy can be affected by atmospheric conditions, number of visible GPS satellites, noise in the radio signal or nearby buildings.
You can resume recording of the GPS data by going to the Advanced dashboard and tapping on the \"Start recording\" button.
To enable GPS from the home screen press the Menu button, select Settings, then Location & Security and check \"Use GPS satellites\".

Two commonly used performance measures for automotive acceleration. Note that you need to make a full stop before using these buttons.

Your current location is unknown. Wait until the GPS receiver has obtained a valid position and try again.
Changes the units in which speed is displayed
With this option enabled, the program will alert you if you have exceeded the chosen speed limit

Set the speed limits for three different types of roads. You can switch between these preset limits by choosing \"Speed limit\" from the Options menu, or by long-tapping on the dashboards (except Advanced)
Select the speed limit for towns and urban areas
For highways and roads outside built-up areas
For freeways and other high speed roadways
Choose an alert sound from the available ringtones
The phone will vibrate as long as you are speeding
Shows a simple digital gauge instead of the \"analog\" speedo and provides some customization options
Enables data such as total trip time, average speed and elevation to be displayed on the main screen

Enables to set different top end speeds on the digital gauge. Note that if you set the speedometer limit to a number greater than its default value of 160 mph (or 240 km/h), you will need to disable the \"Narrow speed range\" option under the \"GPS filtering\" section below
"Allows you to put your cellphone on your car's dash and see the speed reflected in the front glass"
Display additional information in the HUD mode, such as total distance traveled, heading and altitude
Display additional information in the zoom mode, such as total distance traveled, heading and altitude
Set different colors for main parts of the interface
Text color for the current speed on all dashboards
Text color that will be used for the additional info
Color of the speed bar in both speedometer readouts
When enabled, pressing the Back or Home buttons will minimize the program and keep it running in the background. To completely exit the program you will need to select Exit from the Options menu
This option enables you to export your track data in the GPX format. Turning it off saves some memory
Smallest time interval between two recordings of your position
Smallest distance between two recordings of your position
Ignores speeds above 150 mph (approx. 240 km/h). Useful when getting erratic speed readings
The data coming from the GPS receiver will be ignored if your position is not at least this accurate
This feature requires Internet connection. Note that access to and use of the Internet may require payment of a separate fee to a service provider
This option comes in handy when you place your phone in a car dock. It prevents the accelerometer from randomly changing the screen from portrait to landscape when driving on bumpy roads
Uncheck this option to show status bar. This setting is applicable only to portrait screen orientation

Off-road GPS navigator with offline maps support, compass and track recording.
Use offline maps and GPS even without an internet connection. This app is great for hiking, boating, geocaching and other outdoor activities.
Protect your phone with award-winning security & antivirus from Lookout.
Antivirus, Phone Locator, Data Backup and more! Lookout is the #1 Security & Antivirus App for Android. Over 10,000,000 users trust Lookout to protect their phones.

If you are new to SpeedView or GPS-enabled software in general, please read the following section before proceeding. It briefly describes the key features of this app and answers the most commonly asked questions.

Can I use it without a GPS connection?"
Yes, you can review your saved data, use the compass and export your tracks as GPX files. Just tap on the startup screen to skip it.
"How does the compass work?"
When you are moving slower than 3 mph (about 5 km/h) the phone's orientation sensor is used to determine your heading. If you are moving faster than that the GPS is used to determine your heading.
"What is HUD? How do I use it?"
HUD stands for \"head-up display\" and was initially developed for military aviation. In this app, the HUD mode allows you to put your device on your car's dashboard and see the speed reflected in the front glass. This can be useful when driving at night.
"The speedometer stops at 150 mph. Why?"
Because of the \"Narrow speed range\" option that is used to suppress outliers (spikes) in the GPS data, so you will not have erratic top speed numbers (like 345 mph or higher) popping out of nowhere due to GPS errors. This option is turned on by default. You can disable it any time in the app's settings.
"Why does it take so long to get a GPS fix?"
The time required to get a GPS fix is dependent on the number of satellites in view and reception strength of each GPS satellite. This process normally takes 1-2 minutes, however you should not worry if it takes up to 20 minutes on the first occasion. If the receiver in your device will still not acquire a fix, you might want to restart your device. Also note that GPS will not work through heated or heat reflective windscreens. This is due to a metal layer in them which stops the signal.
"The app lags, off by a few mph, etc."
GPS accuracy depends on a number of factors, most notably signal to noise ratio, satellite position, atmospheric conditions and obstructions of satellite signals. These factors can create errors in your perceived location. For example, objects such as buildings or mountains between the satellite and the receiver can produce an error up to 30 meters.
"It drains the battery. Can you add a powersafe mode, only query GPS speed?"
No, that is not how GPS works. In basic terms, GPS satellites send out an identifying signal, a GPS receiver picks up that signal and then the software can determine things such as longitude and latitude, direction, speed, etc.
"How does the track logging feature work?"
It generates a separate log file for each day that you use the app with the track logging option turned on. After a while, SpeedView erases the outdated log files, leaving only the most recent three. When exporting, you will be presented with a choice of which one to convert to the GPX format.
"How often does SpeedView refresh the address in the Pro version?"
Every 100 meters if you are moving slower than 35 mph (about 60 km/h), or every 1000 meters if you are moving faster than that."

Can I use it without a GPS connection?"
Yes, you can review your saved data, use the compass and export your tracks as GPX files. Just tap on the startup screen to skip it.
"How does the compass work?"
When you are moving slower than 3 mph (about 5 km/h) the phone's orientation sensor is used to determine your heading. If you are moving faster than that the GPS is used to determine your heading.

HUD stands for \"head-up display\" and was initially developed for military aviation. In this app, the HUD mode allows you to put your device on your car's dashboard and see the speed reflected in the front glass. This can be useful when driving at night.

Because of the \"Narrow speed range\" option that is used to suppress outliers (spikes) in the GPS data, so you will not have erratic top speed numbers (like 345 mph or higher) popping out of nowhere due to GPS errors. This option is turned on by default. You can disable it any time in the app's settings.
"Why does it take so long to get a GPS fix?"
The time required to get a GPS fix is dependent on the number of satellites in view and reception strength of each GPS satellite. This process normally takes 1-2 minutes, however you should not worry if it takes up to 20 minutes on the first occasion. If the receiver in your device will still not acquire a fix, you might want to restart your device. Also note that GPS will not work through heated or heat reflective windscreens. This is due to a metal layer in them which stops the signal.

GPS accuracy depends on a number of factors, most notably signal to noise ratio, satellite position, atmospheric conditions and obstructions of satellite signals. These factors can create errors in your perceived location. For example, objects such as buildings or mountains between the satellite and the receiver can produce an error up to 30 meters.

No, that is not how GPS works. In basic terms, GPS satellites send out an identifying signal, a GPS receiver picks up that signal and then the software can determine things such as longitude and latitude, direction, speed, etc.

It generates a separate log file for each day that you use the app with the track logging option turned on. After a while, SpeedView erases the outdated log files, leaving only the most recent three. When exporting, you will be presented with a choice of which one to convert to the GPX format."
An ad-free version with more features is available on the Android Market.

This is a major update that adds some often requested features, such as a widget and an ability to quickly tweak speed limits. Please make sure to read the section below for a brief overview of how the widget works.
"• Simple text widget (4x1) • Quickly adjust speed limits • Improved background service • More color customization • Other minor improvements"
"• Simple text widget (4x1) • Quickly adjust speed limits • Improved background service • More color customization • Other minor improvements"
This update fixes remaining issues with the background service, sharing location and the widget. The next release will feature major design changes, so stay tuned!

If you are a new user or experiencing difficulties, we strongly recommend reading the FAQ" first. You can view it by tapping on the corresponding button in the bottom right corner of the screen.
To switch between landscape and portrait modes, use the "Orientation" button under the Options menu. The screen orientation will be restored next time you start SpeedView.
To switch to the "Compass mode, tap once on the linear compass. To enter the HUD mode, tap anywhere on the speedometer area. To quickly reset the odometer or maximum speed to zero, tap on the corresponding field. To open the Advanced screen, tap on the speed graph. You can find the corresponding buttons if you open the Options menu and select Dashboard". To return to default view while in one of these modes, tap anywhere on the screen. You can also use the Back button to return to main screen.
To quickly switch between speed limits, "long-tap" anywhere on one of the main dashboards (excluding Advanced) to select a different speed limit. Then long-tap anywhere on that screen (or use the regular \"Back\" button) to confirm your changes and return to the previous dashboard.
To reset odometer and time traveled, maximum speed, speed graph or all data at once, tap the "Reset data" button.
To change display units, define speed limits, set sound alert, minimum accuracy and other preferences, use the "Settings" menu item.
If you want to use the app without a GPS connection, tap anywhere on the Startup screen to skip it. Note that you can pause the recording of the GPS data anytime by going to the "Advanced dashboard, then tapping on the Stop recording" button.
In case you are experiencing an erratic speed issue or the program freezes after acquiring a GPS fix, try setting the "minimum accuracy" value to 50 meters to ignore most inaccurate data.
If there are any other problems, please do not hesitate to submit a ticket or contact us directly at "speedview@codesector.com.

"SpeedView is an advanced speedometer application that uses the phone's GPS location to calculate speed and distance traveled. Some of the features include: compass, HUD mode, speed graph, maximum and average speed, time traveled, speed warning, background mode, GPX track export and more. This app is suitable for running, car driving, biking or hiking.
Please note that the accuracy of speed readings depends on your GPS reception quality, which can be affected by a multitude of error-introducing factors.
In addition, note that this application is not optimized to run on 7-inch tablets or devices with uncommon screen resolutions. You will be able to run and use it, but it may not display properly. If you have any questions or comments, feel free to post them on our blog.
We would also like to indicate that we reserve the right to anonymously track and report a user's activity inside of SpeedView. We use this data to better understand and improve how this app is being used. If you have any questions or comments, feel free to post them on our blog or send us an email directly using the button below. Your feedback is important to us.
"Thank you for using this app."
"Copyright © 2010-2012 Code Sector

The widget works in conjunction with the app in that it does not have its own configurable settings. Instead, it uses the current preferences set in SpeedView, such as display units, your current speed limit, track logging options, etc. The widget saves the data when you stop it by tapping on it, or when you start the application while the widget is running.
You can reset your settings via the Options menu in the Settings screen.
